alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 25 at 11:47AM MDT until October 25 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM MDT this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 6 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A break in the snow is expected later this afternoon, but another wave of snow overspreads the area later tonight and through the day on Thursday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
